citations.narrative:
Five 10-week-old yellow Labrador Retriever puppies did not have water available to them. The puppies were given water
at 9:30 am and on inspection at 1:30 pm the water bowl was upside down. The puppies were immediate given water and
some did not drink while others drank normally. Potable water, essential for the health and wellbeing of these rapidly
growing puppies, must be continuously available.
Correction date: December 3, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Five 10-week-old yellow Labrador Retriever puppies did not have water available to them. The puppies were given water 
at 9:30 am and on inspection at 1:30 pm the water bowl was upside down. The puppies were immediate given water and 
some did not drink while others drank normally. Potable water, essential for the health and wellbeing of these rapidly 
growing puppies, must be continuously available. 
Correction date: December 3, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
